b"Located in northern Argentina, $CRESY's Los Pozos farm has a cost basis of $25 per acre\xe2\x80\x94circa 1995, with financing from the Quantum Fund\xe2\x80\x94a stirring investment. Its 103,784 acres devoted to livestock are now valued at roughly $3,706 per acre, or $385 million."

That is more akin to the buyouts of $BRK and within the circle of competence.  We zero-in on what those assets are, released tomorrow!"

My view on $IRS is that its stock price is the most transparent way to value it, at least for our purposes.'
